chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan A Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan A Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan A Scott was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Paid in full.  Any remaining bail to be applied to case 15CF562.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha City Police Department.  Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 150 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Cases 15CF562, 15CF410, and 15CM614 called.  Defendant Ryan A Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #3.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count #3.  Counts #1 and 2 are dismissed outright.  Count #4 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #3.  
Sentence of 
150.00 days jail (credit 150 days) TIME SERVED. 
FINE:  $1744.00 Bail to be applied
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00  to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department.  Bail to be applied.
DL REVOCATION:  24 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 24 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through
Remainder of bail to be applied to the cashbail in case #15CF562.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-02-2015 10:30 am

Case 15CF410 called for a motion hearing regarding the search.  Cases 15CF562 and 15CM614 called as a hearing.  Defendant Ryan A Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Bradley Condon sworn in, testified. Officer Chelsea Koenen sworn in, testified.  Defendant sworn in, testified.  Testimony closed.  Parties give closing arguments.  Court grants the motion to suppress the evidence in 15CF410.  Attorney Masnica moves to dismiss counts #1 and 2 in case # 15CF410.  Court denies this request.  All cases are set for a plea and sentencing.  Whatever case does not proceed to a pleah will be set for a jury trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ryan A Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Masnica presents Motion to Dismiss the Criminal Complaint. Attorney Bayer presents arguments. Court does find probable cause and the motion is denied. Officer Chelsea Coenen from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. Testimony is closed. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.
